member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.Geometries.Geometry.AddCoordinate(ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.Geometries.Coordinate)
member.summary: Adds the coordinate at the end of the current part.
member.remarks: The CurrentCoordinateIndex will be updated to match the last position.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.Geometries.Geometry.AddCoordinates(ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.Geometries.CoordinateCollection)
member.summary: Adds the range of coordinates at the end of the current part.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.Geometries.Geometry.InsertCoordinate(ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.Geometries.Coordinate)
member.summary: Adds the coordinate in the current part at the current vertex index.
member.remarks: If the current vertex index is -1, the coordinates will be added at the end of the current part.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.Geometries.Geometry.InsertCoordinates(ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.Geometries.CoordinateCollection)
member.summary: Adds a collection of coordinates in the current part at the current vertex index.
member.remarks: If the current vertex index is -1, the coordinates will be added at the end of the current part. Depending on the geometry type, an InvalidOperationException exception may be thrown (i.e. Point don't support AddRange).

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.Geometries.Geometry.InsertCoordinateAfter(ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.Geometries.Coordinate)
member.summary: Adds the coordinate in the current part after the current vertex index. The current vertex index will be increased by 1.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.Geometries.Geometry.InsertCoordinatesAfter(ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.Geometries.CoordinateCollection)
member.summary: Adds a collection of coordinates in the current part after the current vertex index. The current vertex index will be increased by the number of coordinates inserted.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.Geometries.Geometry.DeleteCurrentCoordinate
member.summary: Deletes the current vertex in the current part.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.Geometries.Geometry.MoveCurrentCoordinate(ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.Geometries.Coordinate)
member.summary: Moves the current vertex in the current part to the specified coordinate.
member.exception: if CurrentPartIndex is less than 0 or CurrentCoordinateIndex is less than 0.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.GlobalId
member.summary: Structure that represent a Geodatabase GlobalId value (Used to guarantee the uniqueness of rows).

member.name: F:ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.GlobalId.Empty
member.summary: A read-only instance of the GlobalId class whose value is guaranteed to be all zeroes.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.GlobalId.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the GlobalId class using the value represented by the specified string.
member.param: A String that contains a GUID in one of the following formats ('d' represents a hexadecimal digit whose case is ignored): 32 contiguous digits: dddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddd -or- Groups of 8, 4, 4, 4, and 12 digits with hyphens between the groups. The entire GUID can optionally be enclosed in matching braces or parentheses: dddddddd-dddd-dddd-dddd-dddddddddddd -or- {dddddddd-dddd-dddd-dddd-dddddddddddd} -or- (dddddddd-dddd-dddd-dddd-dddddddddddd) -or- Groups of 8, 4, and 4 digits, and a subset of eight groups of 2 digits, with each group prefixed by "0x" or "0X", and separated by commas. The entire GUID, as well as the subset, is enclosed in matching braces: {0xdddddddd, 0xdddd, 0xdddd,{0xdd,0xdd,0xdd,0xdd,0xdd,0xdd,0xdd,0xdd}} All braces, commas, and "0x" prefixes are required. All embedded spaces are ignored. All leading zeroes in a group are ignored.The digits shown in a group are the maximum number of meaningful digits that can appear in that group. You can specify from 1 to the number of digits shown for a group. The specified digits are assumed to be the low order digits of the group.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the GlobalId class using the specified array of bytes.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.WinForms.MapPaintEventArgs
member.summary: MapPaintEventArgs is used by the Map Paint event. It contains the MapSurface and Graphics objects. Both MapSurface and Graphics objects should be used but not hold by the client. These objects are disposed by the Map when necessary. Both Graphics and MapSurface objects can be used to draw on the Map. Graphics is using System.Drawing library and works in screen units. MapSurface is using map units.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.WPF.GraphicLayer.Fill
member.summary: Gets or sets the System.Windows.Media.Brush that specifies how the Geometry's interior is painted. This property applies only to Polygon and Point Geometry's. It has no effect on PolyLine geometry. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.WPF.GraphicLayer.FillOpacity
member.summary: Gets or sets the opacity factor applied to the entire Geometry when it is rendered in the user interface (UI). This is a dependency property. Value range is from 0-1.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.Gps.SerialPortGpsConnection
member.summary: Connection between GPSDisplay and a GPS receiver using NMEA sentences for GPS data though a serial port.
member.remarks: The SerialPortGpsConnection allows communication with a GPS receiver using the NMEA standard. The SerialPortGpsConnection class is usually obtained from the component itself inside the IDE toolbox. To receive GPS information set the SerialPort communication properties (Com, Parity, BaudRate) and subsequently call the Open method. You will receive positional information through the NMEASentenceEventArgs class. This class is a product of the GpsChanged event, which is raised when the GPS positional information changes. The SerialPortGpsConnection uses a lower priority worker type thread to interact with the SerialPort, and the event (GpsChanged) is initially raised on this worker thread.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.Gps.SerialPortGpsConnection.OnOpen
member.summary: Opens a new SerialPort connection within the NativeSerialPortGpsConnection class and starts reading sentences arriving via the port.
member.remarks: There can be only one SerialPort connection within the SerialPortGpsConnection object. The best practices for any application is to wait for some amount of time after calling close before attempting to re-open by calling the Open method. Be aware the port may not be closed instantly.
member.exception: "An invalid operation has occurred on the specified Port"

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.Gps.SerialPortGpsConnection.OnClose
member.summary: Closes the underlying SerialPort within the NativeGpsConnection and terminates the reading of sentences via the port.
member.remarks: This action will set the IsOpen property to false. The best practices for any application is to wait for some amount of time after calling OnClose before attempting to re-open by calling the OnOpen method. Be aware the port may not be closed instantly.

member.summary: Handle each new GPS sentence and writes it to the log file if necessary

member.exception: Invalid operation on the COM port.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.Gps.SerialPortGpsConnection.BaudRate
member.summary: Gets or sets the serial baud rate.
member.remarks: The serial baud rate must be supported by the user's serial driver. The default value is 4800 bits per second (bps).
member.exception: Property cannot be changed if connection is open.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.Gps.SerialPortGpsConnection.PortName
member.summary: Gets or sets port name. Port name can be as follows: AUTO - COM port auto detect COMn - COM port (n - any number). E.g. "COM1", "COM5", or "COM999" n - equal to COMn (n - any number). E.g. "1", "5", or "999"
member.exception: Property cannot be changed if connection is open.
Port name is invalid, e.g. it is negative.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.Gps.SerialPortGpsConnection.UsedPortName

member.summary: Gets or sets the full path of the logging file. If null or empty then no logging will be made. Logging will always override existing file.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.Geometries.Polygon
member.summary: A geometry representing an ordered sequence of points which describe a closed figure.

remarks.para: Represents a collection of rings ordered by their containment relationship. The rings do not need to be connected to or contained by other rings in the polygon.
A ring is a shell if coordinates are organized in clockwise order, otherwise is a hole.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Polygon class.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Polygon class.

remarks.para: The input CoordinateCollection object inserted as a shell.

member.remarks: All elements in the list are inserted into the polygon as closed rings.

description.para: or number of coordinates in any part <3,

member.remarks: This function makes sure that all parts have a valid shell (a closed clockwise ring), and removes duplicated points and empty parts.

member.summary: Adds a new hole to the polygon.
member.exception: Null coordinate collection for the hole.

remarks.para: If the parameter hole is not a closed counter-clockwise ring, this function makes it a hole by reversing coordinate order and/or adding the first coordinate to the end if need.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.Geometries.Polygon.EquivalentTo(ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.Geometries.IGeometry)
member.summary: Determines whether two Polygon instances are equal.
member.returns: Returns true when two Polygons are equal
member.remarks: Two polygons are equal when they have the same number of parts, which contain the same sets of points in the same order.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.Geometries.Polygon.InsertPart(System.Int32,ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.Geometries.CoordinateCollection)
member.summary: Inserts a copy of the coordinate collection as a part at the specific index.
member.exception: if part contains less than 4 coordinates

remarks.para: If the coordinates are in clockwise order, the input coordinatecollection will be inserted as a Shell, otherwise as a Hole.
This function closes part the ring if not closed.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.Geometries.Polygon.AddPart(ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.Geometries.CoordinateCollection)
member.summary: Adds a new hole or shell to the polygon.

remarks.para: If the coordinates are in clockwise order, it will be inserted as a shell, otherwise as a hole.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.Geometries.Polygon.InsertCoordinatesAfter(ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.Geometries.CoordinateCollection)
member.summary: Adds the range of coordinates in the current part after the current vertex index. The current vertex index will be increased by the number of coordinates inserted.
member.remarks: If the current vertex index is -1, the coordinates will be added at the end of the current part.

member.summary: Creates a new instance.

member.summary: Creates a new instance.

member.summary: Creates a new instance.

member.summary: Returns a String that represents the current Object.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.FeatureCaching.MobileCache.Open
member.summary: Opens the cache.

remarks.para: A Mobilecache must be opened before it can be consumed by Map control.

Before a Mobilecache can be opened, the MobileCache files (which are stored in the folder as defined by MobileCache.StoragePath) must be available. If the Mobilecache files do not exist with layer schemas ready, they need to be created by MobileCache.Create method.
For reading/writing purposes, the Mobilecache file will be locked once it's opened. To explicitly unlock a Mobilecache file, use Mobilecache.Close.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.FeatureCaching.MobileCache.OnOpened(System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Raises the Opened event.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.FeatureCaching.MobileCache.OnClosed(System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Raises the Closed event.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.FeatureCaching.MobileCache.OnClosing(System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Raises the Closing event.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.FeatureCaching.MobileCache.DeleteCache
member.summary: Deletes the cache files and directory. If the cache is not correctly defined or the it's opened, an exception will be raised.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.FeatureCaching.MobileCache.Close
member.summary: Close the cache file.

remarks.para: A mobilecache needs to be closed if it's going to be used to connect to a different web service. After the mobilecache file is closed, the lock on the file will be released.
When a mobilecache file is closed, cached data will remain in the cache file.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.FeatureCaching.MobileCache.RemoveData(ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.Geometries.Envelope)
member.summary: Removes data for the given envelope and scale.

remarks.para: If the envelope is null, all data will be removed from the Mobilecache.
RemoveData doesn't affect schema stored in the Mobilecache, and it doesn't affect anything on server side.
Removing data from Mobilecache is different from adding/deleting/updating features and associated attributes. For more information, see mobile geodatabase editing.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.FeatureCaching.MobileCache.RemoveData(ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.Geometries.Envelope,ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.FeatureCaching.FeatureSource[])
member.summary: For a list of feature sources, removes all the data (features and raster) from the cache for the specified envelope and scale.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.FeatureCaching.MobileCache.RemoveData(ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.Geometries.Envelope,System.Collections.Generic.IList{ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.FeatureCaching.FeatureSource})
member.summary: For a list of feature source, removes all the data (features and raster) from the cache for the specified envelope and scale.

member.summary: Pass in a tile package to read, the central directory will be read an filesnames cached. this method is not thread safe, so ensure thre's only one call to it on an instance of this class. Note: Read is thread safe.

member.param: file within the zip file to open. It is case insensitive.
posistion within the file to read
number of bytes to read, a -1 will read to the end of the file

member.summary: Indicates that the request is no longer in the waiting list, the RequestManager will start to process it. If the request is atomic, the next event raised will be the RequestCompleted event. If the Request requires sub steps, a series of RequestProgressChanged events may be raised with the RequestProgressStep sets to Processing.

member.name: F:ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.FeatureCaching.RequestProgressStep.Processing
member.summary: Used by certain requests if the processing requires sub steps with the server.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.FeatureCaching.FeaturesChangedType
member.summary: Used by MobileServiceDataChangedEventArgs to describe the type of data change.

member.name: F:ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.FeatureCaching.FeaturesChangedType.None
member.summary: No changes.

member.name: F:ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.FeatureCaching.FeaturesChangedType.FeaturesRetrieved
member.summary: Features have been retrieved from the server and inserted in the MobileService cache.

member.name: F:ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.FeatureCaching.FeaturesChangedType.FeaturesRemoved
member.summary: Features have been removed from the cache.

member.name: F:ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.FeatureCaching.FeaturesChangedType.FeaturesAdded
member.summary: Features have been created and added in the MobileService cache.

member.name: F:ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.FeatureCaching.FeaturesChangedType.FeaturesModified
member.summary: Features have been modified in the MobileService cache.

member.name: F:ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.FeatureCaching.FeaturesChangedType.FeaturesUpdated
member.summary: Features that have been Updated being retrieved from the server and inserted in the MobileService cache.

member.name: F:ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.FeatureCaching.FeaturesChangedType.FeaturesDeleted
member.summary: Features have been marked as deleted in the MobileService cache.

member.name: F:ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.FeatureCaching.FeaturesChangedType.FeaturesRolledBack
member.summary: Previously deleted, modified, or added features have been rolled back in the cache.

member.name: F:ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.FeatureCaching.FeaturesChangedType.FeaturesCommitted
member.summary: Previously deleted, modified, or added features have been committed in the cache.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.FeatureCaching.EditState
member.summary: Describes the state of features in the cache. Used fro query or as properties or returned argument on FeatureDataRow, FeatureDataReader, and FeatureDataRecord.

member.name: F:ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.FeatureCaching.EditState.NotDefined
member.summary: The feature is not defined in the cache. This value cannot be used for querying.

member.name: F:ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.FeatureCaching.EditState.Original
member.summary: The feature has never been modified, it's in its original state when pulled from the server. When used for a query, the query will returned features as when they were pulled from the server.

member.name: F:ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.FeatureCaching.EditState.Current
member.summary: When used in a query, all the current features: added, modified, or original that have not been modified or deleted.

member.name: F:ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.FeatureCaching.EditState.Deleted
member.summary: The feature has been marked as deleted. When used for a query, the query will returned features that have been marked as deleted.

member.name: F:ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.FeatureCaching.EditState.Modified
member.summary: The feature has been modified. When used for a query, the query will returned features that have been modified.

member.name: F:ESRI.ArcGIS.Mobile.FeatureCaching.EditState.Added
member.summary: The feature has been added by the user on in the cache. It's a new feature. When used for a query, the query will returned added features.

member.remarks: For IList, if the same object appears multiple times in the list, the IndexOf will return the index for the first instance. In DataColumnCollection, this won't happen because any DataColumn in the ArcMap document (published as service) is considered as a different DataColumn, even if they refer to the same source feature class in the mxd document.
